text:
Any log which does not
contain the dreaded reload/rebuild the performance library blah blah blah
filler. Is helpful. Seems an overzealous security team read somewhere that
accepting defaults on AV software which is designed to hose anything useful on a
server like log libraries is a good thing. I’d use all logs including update and
setup logs if they weren’t already broken. Logs are the one tool overlooked in
resolving issues when it’s easier to blame the network, or AD… Sent from my
iPhone
Link: None

metadata.topic: Re: Do you look at update logs?

[You don't often get email from jeiversen@gmail.com. Learn why this is important
